result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on August 21, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Approving DEOJ Agreement
DEOJ Agreement

Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 10:10 am. 
INCLUDES: 22CF302 and 22CF207. 

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears via zoom, and with Attorney Natasha VanLieshout.  

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
22CF207 --
Ct.1(Strangulation and Suffocation/Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Battery/Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
REMOVE Domestic Abuse enhancer on Ct.3;

22CF302 --
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Operate w/o valid license (2nd w/in 3 years))>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
22CF207 --
Ct.3(DC)>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis.

COURT withholds finding and entry of guilt - Court adopts written Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to the Court.
COURT defers matter for a period of 1 year for Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.3;

DEOJ RH set for 8/21/2023 at 9:00 am.
Bond continues.


Adj: 10:20 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Trevor Peterson

Court orders $4,000.00 signature bond, with first $750.00 in cash.   No contact with victim(s): D.S.I. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort (Wausau P.D.) to retrieve personal property from the residence.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
